ons, 04,.05.2005 kl. 14.28 +0200, skrev Christian Kohlschuetter:
> On Wednesday 04 May 2005 13:51, John Erik Halse wrote:
> > -1
> >
> > Mainly because it makes it much harder to test non-public methods.
> >
> > The other reasons for me to keep it as it is, are mostly a matter of
> > taste. I don't see the pollution of the source tree as a problem, but
> > that's just my opinion.
> >
> > John Erik Halse
> 
> Hi John Erik,
> 
> just a small comment for clarification.
> 
> Moving classes to another source folder does not mean moving into another 
> package. The separation of application and test classes which I propose would 
> result in a directory structure similar to the following one:
> 
> src/
>     main/
>         org/
>             archive/
>                 crawler/
>                     Heritrix.java
>     test/
>         org/
>             archive/
>                 crawler/
>                     HeritrixTest.java
>                     SimpleHttpServerMockup.java
>                     example-order.xml
> 
> Despite the two source folders, HeritrixTest and Heritrix still remain in the 
> same (logical) package, namely org.archive.crawler. That way, you can still 
> test methods with default (package) or protected visibility.
> 
> 
> Christian
